intro: Tricliceras elatum, commonly known as the golden flame fern, is a striking tropical plant characterized by its vibrant, golden-yellow fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to the humid rainforests of Southeast Asia. The plant features a compact rhizome system that supports its upright growth habit. Its fronds are bi-directionally divided, creating a feathery appearance that enhances its ornamental value. Tricliceras elatum thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture and high humidity to flourish.
